sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: SESELI, meadow saxifrage, in botany: A genus of plants belonging to the claſs of pentandria, and to the order of digynia ; and in the natural ſyſtem ranging under the 45th order, Umbellatae. The umbels are globular ; the involucrum conſiſts of one or two leaflets ; the fruit is egg-ſhaped and ſtreaked. There are 11 ſpecies, the pimpinelloides. montanum, glaucum, annuum, ammoides, tortuoſum, turbith, hyppomarathrum, pyrenaeum, ſaxiſragum, and elatum. The montanum grows naturally in France and Italy ; the glaucum is a native of France ; the ammoides and tortuoſum grow in the ſouth of Europe ; and the hyppomarathrum is a native of Auſtria;
